page.title: 15ECOLOGY
page.content: There has been a small wood at Perry Beeches since 1840;it was a mature mixed woodland in an area that almost exactly corresponds with the present nature reserve.The wood remained intact until a shortage of coal in the 1940's resulted in local people felling the trees for fuel. The wood began to recover naturally but the uncared-for appearance of the wood attracted vandals and fly tippers. The opening of the M6 Motorway in 1972 caused noise and air pollution problems as well as impeding natural drainage. In 1984 a Manpower Services Commission finaced team from Task Undertakings Ltd.cleared the 4.5 acres of rubbish and constructed a network of paths;the sycamores were felled and a pond was dug. The reserve is open to all local schools.
